intro: Impatiens echinosperma, commonly known as the spiny-seed impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its stems are often hairy as well. Its unique feature is the spiny, woody蒴 (capsule) that encloses its seeds, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
